visualization.name: Heatmap Matrix
visualization.description: Renders a heatmap from a CSV matrix with first row and column as labels
visualization.help:
# What is the Heatmap Matrix?
This visualization allows you to create interactive heatmap matrix plots from your tabular or CSV data using the [Plotly](https://plotly.com/) library.
After selecting a dataset, a two-dimensional grid will be rendered where the first row and first column serve as categorical labels, and the cell colors represent your data values.
## Key Features
- **Heatmap Matrix Rendering**: Visualize data in a grid where color intensity encodes value magnitude. - **Interactive Controls**: Hover over cells to see values, zoom, and pan freely. - **Categorical Axes**: Use the first row and first column as meaningful labels for your x and y axes. - **Pattern Recognition**: Quickly spot trends, clusters, and outliers in your dataset.
This tool is ideal for visualizing correlation matrices, experimental data grids, or any tabular dataset where relationships between rows and columns are important.
To learn more about Plotly, visit: [https://plotly.com/](https://plotly.com/)
